# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width = 10)
    lines = []
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in splitstrip(text)
        if occursin(r"^\s+$", word) || length(current_line) + length(word) + 2 > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line *= " " * word
        end
    end
    
    push!(lines, current_line)
    
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage:
wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines", 20)
```
In this example, the `wrap_string` function takes a text and a maximum line width. It splits the text into words, wrapping to a new line when the specified width is exceeded. The wrapped text is then returned as a string with newline characters between each line.
